DOC.HEAD: Rebels Reportedly Kill 25 Civilians
DOC.TEXT: At least 25 civilians were massacred by rebels after being abducted from their homes in southern Mozambique, the national news agency reported Sunday. The news agency, AIM, said the killings occurred Friday near Xai-Xai, capital of Gaza Province. It said it least 19 people were wounded. The killings were blamed on guerrillas of the Mozambique National Resistance, which has waged a hit-and-run insurgency against the leftist government since 1977.
